headlines.byline: Joe Parkinson in Pretoria, South Africa, and Gabriele Steinhauser in Johannesburg
headlines.headline: South Africa Report Cites Signs of Government Corruption
headlines.text: An official report said President Jacob Zuma should appoint a commission of inquiry into whether his dealings with a wealthy family led to undue influence over government appointments.

headlines.headline: Pope’s Beatitudes Highlight Care for Environment and Outsiders

headline.text: Pope’s Beatitudes Highlight Care for Environment and Outsiders
headline.name: headline

p.text: Pope Francis proposed contemporary Beatitudes, adding environmentalism and ecumenism to the core set of Christian ideals such as meekness and mercy enunciated by Jesus in the Bible.

headlines.headline: Dow Falls Third Month in a Row

headline.text: Dow Falls Third Month in a Row
headline.name: headline

p.text: U.S. stocks fell. The Dow Jones Industrial Average dropped for a third consecutive month, for its longest stretch of declines since 2011.

headlines.headline: How Slavic Became the Flavor of the Moment
headlines.text: Fermented, foraged, whole-grain and invigoratingly herbal, everything we’re craving is straight out of Central and Eastern Europe. Why does this old-world food seem so right-now?

headlines.headline: U.S. Lawmakers Ask Treasury to Block Zhongwang Takeover of Aleris

headline.text: U.S. Lawmakers Ask Treasury to Block Zhongwang Takeover of Aleris
headline.name: headline

p.text: A dozen U.S. senators asked the Obama administration to block a Chinese company’s $1.1 billion bid to take over a U.S. aluminum manufacturer, a deal that had surprised many U.S. aluminum-industry officials who have grown concerned about competition from China.
p.name: p

headline.name: headline

headlines.byline: Chun Han Wong in Beijing and William Wilkes in Frankfurt
headlines.headline: China Cautions Germany Over Aixtron-Deal Halt

headline.text: China Cautions Germany Over Aixtron-Deal Halt
headline.name: headline

p.text: China has warned that Germany’s decision to withdraw approval for a Chinese acquisition of chip maker Aixtron could hurt bilateral economic ties and said German concerns about Chinese takeovers are unwarranted.
p.name: p

headlines.headline: Report Shows China Censorship Machine Not The Monolith You Think It Is
headlines.text:
On China’s popular streaming video app YY, you can chat about the Dalai Lama or the party drug ecstasy, but if you want to talk about people from Henan province stealing manhole covers, you’ll have to switch to a different app. 

More in the full post.

headlines.byline: Ruth Bender and Mohammad Nour Alakraa
headlines.headline: In Germany, Refugees Provide Terror Tipoffs but Investigations Prove Tricky
headlines.text: After fleeing violence in the Middle East, refugees are banding together to hound suspected terrorists and war criminals hiding among them in Europe, but the effort is yielding mixed results.

headlines.headline: Greece Bucks EU, U.S. on Sanctions for Iran’s Largest Bank

headline.text: Greece Bucks EU, U.S. on Sanctions for Iran’s Largest Bank
headline.name: headline

p.text: Greece has defied its European allies and Washington by blocking European Union sanctions on an Iranian bank the U.S. accuses of financing terrorism, officials familiar with the move say.

headlines.headline: Eurozone Factory Survey Shows Expansion

headline.text: Eurozone Factory Survey Shows Expansion
headline.name: headline

p.text: Eurozone factories had their most active month for almost three years in October, and raised their prices for the first time in more than a year, according to a survey of purchasing managers.
p.name: p

Maduro Threatens to Imprison Venezuela Opposition
headlines.text: Talks between President Nicolás Maduro and the opposition meant to defuse the country’s political crisis are off to a shaky start after the embattled leftist leader threatened to jail rivals advocating for street demonstrations.

headlines.headline: Mexican President’s Ally Is Set to Get Anticorruption Post

headline.text: Mexican President’s Ally Is Set to Get Anticorruption Post
headline.name: headline

p.text: President Enrique Peña Nieto’s has set up a close ally to become Mexico’s first independent prosecutor, spurring accusations that he seeks to shield his scandal-plagued government from the kind of inquiry the new post was meant to ensure.
p.name: p

headlines.headline: Venezuela Opposition Cancels Protest March to Presidential Palace

headline.text: Venezuela Opposition Cancels Protest March to Presidential Palace
headline.name: headline

p.text: Venezuela’s opposition canceled a protest march to the presidential palace, bowing to what adversaries of embattled President Nicolas Maduro said was a call from the Vatican to defuse rising tensions in this oil-rich country.
p.name: p

headlines.headline: Iraqi Forces Pause Mosul Advance to Clear Islamic State Fighters
headlines.text: Iraqi special forces paused their advance in an eastern district of Mosul to clear a neighborhood of any remaining Islamic State militants, killing eight while carrying out house-to-house clearances.

headlines.headline: Oil Drops on Record Inventory Build

headline.text: Oil Drops on Record Inventory Build
headline.name: headline

p.text: Oil prices dropped sharply as weekly inventory data revealed the largest weekly increase in crude-oil stockpiles in 34 years of data collected by the U.S. Energy Information Administration.
p.name: p
